content.description: It's a very tight squeeze chimney, but it was fun to give it a try. I exited at the top and walked down. You can lower, but it is so tight that it seemed easier to walk down.
content.location: This is the narrow chimney behind Petroleum Based Buttress and the main cliff, to the left of FK Face.

content.description: Essentially a linkup of FK Face and South End. From 10 feet on FK, execute a tough traverse right to the arete, joining it at or above the obvious bulge. Continue with ease to the top. Lots of small and sharp holds on this one.
content.location: Right side of FK Face, climbs prominent arete.

content.description: Old School 5.9. This demanding line goes up the middle of the vertical to slightly overhung FK Face. A bouldery start leads to awkwardly angled crimps and other painful holds. Tricky.
content.protection: No pro. TR from anchors at top, accessed by jumping onto the top of the Petroleum Based Buttress and walking down to the end.
content.location: On the narrow face just right of City Dump and a chimney.

content.description:
This is a tiny, 20 foot crag which faces south.  No fixed anchors above. 

  L->R:   A. Squeeze Chimney, 4, 1p, 20', TR.   B1. FK Face, 9, 1p.   B2. Nob Job, 9, 1p.   C. South End, 7 (continues on Petroleum Based Buttress), 1p, 20', TR.
